page.title: 19Customs in NW Derby
page.content: The{Mayor's Parade}of floats, bands and Morrismen tours the City Centre. The parade is held every year towards the end of June. There is a{Raft Race}on the River Derwent at Darley Abbey every New Year's Day. There is another organ- ised by the Bridge Inn, Mansfield Rd. in July. The{Pancake Race}is held annually in Darley Abbey. You have to toss a pan- cake and catch it in a frying pan while you run. Walter Evans Primary School in Darley Abbey is carrying on the tradition of {Maypole Dancing}on the first of May. It celebrates the beginning of Summer. The unique Derbyshire custom of{Well {Dressing}is now held in summer at Chester Green and St. Alkmunds Well. A vicar blesses the well with Holy Water.
